Key Match Events: Iceland scored early through Jon Dagur Thorsteinsson
Thorsteinsson stunned Wembley with the breakthrough on 12 minutes
Southgate had to urge his players to stay calm midway through the first half
England hinted at the equaliser after the restart, but could not score
Iceland almost caught out Ramsdale from distance, but Kolbeinn Finnsson missed
Post-Match Reflections: There were boos at half-time and they would return with increased force upon the final whistle
Southgate’s team did not look as though they believed they would equalise as the second-half minutes ticked down and the truth was they could have conceded again
It was the worst possible start for England
Miscellaneous Highlights: John Stones was slow to get across and close down when Thorsteinsson cut inside to unload for the near post
Palmer had plenty of the goal to aim at with Valdimarsson out of position
Gordon’s ability to run with the ball and beat his man was an isolated plus point
Ramsdale, who had been given the opportunity ahead of Jordan Pickford, looked disappointed with himself
